page.title: 18NEW ENGLAND FARM
page.content: Situated in the Southern region of our area is New England Farm. The farm has an attractive setting of grassland and trees around it. It used to be connected physically to New England Stud but now a road separates the two. This farm is unusual in our area in that it has live stock. It caters for race horses and at the present time has only four. It can have a lot more as there are twenty eight stables. The horses go to the farm as a resting place to get over an injury or illness. One we saw had a back injury and was able to have a whole field to its self. The farm also is a place where horses which have just flown in from abroad are able to unwind and there are large barns for this purpose. Some workmen were demolishing some old sheds to make way for new stables.
